website_summaries.verdict: The top-of-the-line body groomer from Philips Norelco is also the best of its class on the market. Period.
pros: Just about perfect in terms of versatility – can be used wet or dry
Incredibly long-lasting and has 18 length settings
Trims everything from ear hair to a beard
cons: Costs a bit more than competing products, but it also has more features than other offerings

customer_reviews.title: Wrong battery
customer_reviews.text: Although the description says lithium ion battery, documentation that was included with the unit says it has a nimh battery. This is a less expensive and slower charging battery then what was advertised.
customer_reviews.author: WhiteLight

customer_reviews.title: NO LITHIUM-ION BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: Product description ERROR Lithium-ion battery stays charged for up to 50 minutes of trimming after a 1 hour charge. There is NO LITHIUM-ION BATTERY The Battery is NiMH. Is this battery inferior to the lithium battery: YES Does the trimmer still function well: Yes Minus two stars for inaccuracy and inferior battery. Norelco should revise their documentation or change the battery in the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Philips Norelco QG3372/41 "NO LITHIUM-ION BATTERY"

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life... stopped working
customer_reviews.text: As others have pointed out, the battery life on this is non-existent even if you charge it all night. Sometimes the razors would take off more hair than expected on some parts of the face even if you had it set to the same level for your entire face (literally had a patchy beard the first time I used it). I was a big fan of the series 3000 version, but unfortunately they don't seem to sell that model anymore. Regardless, 0/10 wouldn't recommend this!!

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. I had a 10 year old trimmer that the guides broke. Turbo is what the old one was at by default. Guides work on old trimmer so I now have two. Otis nice to use standard speed to fine trim and turbo to plow through growth.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY, ONLY WORKED FOR 3 MONTHS!
customer_reviews.text: I received this trimmer at the end of April and about 3 weeks ago it stopped working properly. It was fully charged and about 3-5 seconds into shaving it stopped. I tried a few more times and it kept stopping, which hurts btw... I plugged it in again, let it charge for a few hours, and the problem was still there. I left it plugged in while trimming and was able to finish with it stopping only a few times. My previous trimmer worked for about 3 years without issues and this one barely made it 3 months. No option to return it now so it was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Neria

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance, worse battery life.
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be the next model of multigrooms from the one I've used for ~4 years. By comparison, this one misses many more whiskers/hairs, necessitating more passes to trim everything. The specific one I received appeared to have a defective battery as it could not maintain a charge for longer than a couple hours (e.g.: I would use it for ~20min while trimming and while sitting idle for the next couple hours, it would die). The turbo mode seems to be the same speed the old one always ran at so that's not a valuable addition.
customer_reviews.author: Rob K

customer_reviews.title: This Norelco is wonderful and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I have short hair and use it to trim the back-of-neck hairs that grow out and diminish my hairstyle. My husband uses it for the wild, white hairs that grow on his face and that do not come off with his shaver. He cannot readily see them because of the color. We previously used a Remington bikini shaver. When the blades wore out, we bought another. However, most recently, they've come out with a cheaply made product that doesn't work well. This Norelco is wonderful and reasonably priced.

customer_reviews.title: Maintenance is for sissies
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year now. It started to not evenly trim my beard and it would take longer and longer to get the trim done. Recently when I would trim, the power would start then stop. After reading reviews I was getting really frustrated with the trimmer. Then I read the manual, and realized I hadn't done any maintenance since I've owned it. I cleaned the trimmer head running it under warm water and brushed out the drive motor. Then applied the machine lubricate to the cutting heads along the front and back, attached it to the holder and let it run for a bit. Now it literally works like new. All of my issues were resolved.

Style Name:4 AttachmentsIf you are looking for one tool, to craft your facial style, this is the trimmer for you. The Philips Norelco Multigroom 3100, is a versatile trimmer for your face and head. The self-sharpening blades made of finely ground Chromium steel ensure long-lasting performance, while rounded blade tips and combs prevent skin irritation. The 18 built-in length settings gives you all you need to create any facial style you want. A high-performance rechargeable battery provides 60 minutes of cordless use after a 10-hour charge and is adaptable for worldwide voltage. The device is fully washable, simply rinse device under faucet for easy cleaning. Multigroom 3100 comes with a 45 day risk-free trial and a full 2-year warranty.
